div1.p: It is requested that you act as judge in the Hilton Ross Greer Contest sponsored by the Poetry Society of Texas with closing date for entries October 1, 1959, if permitted.
We have been greatly favored by your judgment in the past and your name has come up in the connection, with request that I write you. The enclosed announcement will explain the nature of the contest.
Poems will be mailed shortly after that date, with complete instructions. You will be the sole judge, in case you accept. There should be some twenty entries, I should say.

closer.salute: With best personal wishes, I am,

div1.p: * Awards marked with an asterisk are open also to poets who are non-members. All others are limited to the membership.
(All entries must conform to Rules Governing Annual Contests)

item.p: *The Dr. A. p.hi: Please check you entries point by point. Many good poems are disqualified, because contestant overlooked a Rule.

list.item: 1. Annual Contests, unless otherwise specified, are open only to active members whose dues for the current year have been paid by the closing date for submissions of entries, to life members, and to officers of the Society.

2. ELIGIBILITY:
a. Entries must be postmarked not later than October 1, 1959, unless otherwise specified.
b. Each entry must be the original work of the contestant.
c. Contestant may enter poems in as many classes as desired, but only one poem may be entered in any one class. A poem entered in one class may not be entered, in whole or in part, in any other class.
d. A poem may not be entered in a class in which the contestant has won the award the preceding year.
e. A poem is not eligible which, in whole or part, has been published in print, presented over radio or television, or accepted for publication; or which is in the hands of an editor for consideration, or entered in any contest running concurrently.
f. Poems, other than winners of the Critic's Award, which have been entered in monthly or special contests and are otherwise eligible, are eligible for entry in the annual contests.
g. An eligible poem may not be withdrawn after submission.

3. REQUIREMENTS:
a.
ONE ORIGINAL TYPEWRITTEN COPY WITH CARBON COPY, unless otherwise specified. New regulation this year. Unless otherwise specified, contestant must submit one original typwritten copy, with carbon copy, of each poem on 8Â½ by 11-inch paper, using one side of sheet only. Contestants should retain copies of their entries, as no manuscripts will be returned.
b.
SHOW CLASS AT TOP OF SHEET. Contestants must show the class in which a poem is entered on each copy, at top of sheet.
DO NOT SHOW NAME OF AUTHOR ON MANUSCRIPT.The author's name and address must NOT appear on manuscript, but must be typed on a SEPARATE sheet with the poem title (or titles), and sealed in an Identification Envelope which accompanies the entries. On the OUTSIDE of this Identification Envelope, list the title (or titles), with the class in which each title is entered. One Identification Envelope is sufficient, regardless of the number of poems submitted.
c.
Entries which fail to conform to the Rules will be eliminated by the Annual Contest Committee.
d.
Each class shall be judged by one competent judge, unless otherwise specified. If, in the opinion of the judge, no entry in a class measures up to the desired standard, the Society may withhold the award.
e.
Prize-winning poems may not be printed elsewhere before they appear in the Yearbook of the Society (except in special instances when a donor may wish to publish the poem he sponsored); thereafter, full rights revert to the author. The Society releases all claim to non-winning poems upon announcements of awards.
f.
All manuscripts are correspondance concerning contests must be addressed to Faye Carr Adams, Corresponding Secretary, Poetry Society of Texas, 4244 Skillman, Dallas 14, Texas.
